unnormalised: Hey guys, someone asked about the difference between ranks in the Indian Armed Forces. It's a bit confusing, I know! So, like, a Sepoy in the Indian Army is the equivalent of an Aircraftsman in the IAF or a Sailor in the Indian Navy. They are the starting point. Then it goes up from there.
normalised: Hey guys, someone asked about the difference between ranks in the Indian Armed Forces. It's a bit confusing, I know! So, like, a Sepoy in the Indian Army is the equivalent of an Aircraftsman in the I-A-F or a Sailor in the Indian Navy. They are the starting point. Then it goes up from there.

unnormalised: In the Army, after Sepoy, you have Lance Naik, Naik, Havildar, and so on. In the Air Force, it's Leading Aircraftsman, Corporal, Sergeant etc. And in the Navy, it's Leading Seaman, Petty Officer, Chief Petty Officer. My uncle was a Capt. in the Signals regiment, super proud of him! He always used to tell me stories, though most of them were NDA secrets, haha.

unnormalised: Basically, just remember that they all have different names for the same level of experience and authority. A Major General in the Army is kind of similar to a Vice Admiral in the Navy or an Air Marshal in the IAF, but their actual responsibilities would depend on their branch. And BTW, my cousin wants to join the forces too, wants to be a Lt. Gen someday! Wish him luck!
